REMEMBERING RUBEN ABREU

Bridgeport native, arts and culture activist, co-founder of City Lights Bridgeport in 1981.

Community involvement includes WICC, WPKN, Initiating Public Access TV at UB, Sweetport concerts on McLevy Green.

BAT 2021 Highlights

Shop local, handmade and vintage this holiday season and a photo opp with Krumpus.

Enjoy live music at the Arcade Mall 1001 Main St, City Lights Vintage 265 Golden Hill St.

.

“It’s Complicated” group exhibit at City Lights Gallery, 265 Golden Hill St

Exhibiting artists: Maralyn Adlin, Carlos Bautista Biernnay, Claude Desir Jr, Dan Makara, Marcella Kurkowski, Tunde Odunlade, Mark Rich, Gerald Saladyga, Isabella Saraceni, Roxanne Faber Savage, Scott Schuldt, Joan Wheeler

Curated by Suzanne Kachmar

Fiber art, paintings, drawing and assemblage in this exhibit contain contradictory, ambiguous content with complex imagery and compositions. Although materials and techniques vary, all artists in this exhibit practice the sincere process of artmaking, combining automatism, criticism, and plan.

This exhibit encourages the viewer to spend time with complexity and uncertainty and find meaning from the personal interaction with the art.

The show is designed to encourage that we maintain an open mind and an open heart.

Art by Gerald Saladyga

See light projection for the Winter Solstice from Berlinetta Brewing, 90 Golden Hill St.

OCTOBER 2021

ARTcade 10/24/21, 12-7 pm

THE FRANKENSTEIN TWINS COME TO BRIDGEPORT, HOSTING THE ODDIITIES BAZAAR

The Frankenstein Twins are thrilled to bring their annual Oddities Bazaar to ARTCade at the Arcade Mall Bridgeport Oct. 24 from 12-7 p.m.

The Oddities Bazaar will feature local artists, crafters, and fine purveyors of curiosities large and small. All of the event’s nearly 30 vendors have been handpicked for their dark, mystical, and spooky aesthetics. Goods will include crystals, handmade soaps, metaphysical goods, weird and witchy accessories and apparel, and both new and vintage oddities, tomes, and curios.

“We’re extremely grateful for the opportunity to work with the team at the Arcade Mall Bridgeport to bring a bit of weird to downtown Bridgeport just in time for Halloween,” says Val Frankenstein, one half of the Frankenstein Twins.

In addition to the bazaar’s vendors, the event will feature an art installation and several other spooky guests and performers staged throughout the Arcade Mall rotunda. It is also expected that several of the venue’s permanent retailers will be open for limited hours during the event.

“All of the entertainment at the Oddities Bazaar is part of our mission to ‘Make Connecticut Weird,’” says Finn Frankenstein, the other half of the duo. “We’re so excited to share this year’s event with everyone.”

The Arcade Mall is located at 1042 Broad St. Bridgeport, CT 06604.

“LATINISIIMO” SAT 9/18/21

4 Great FREE events happening in downtown Bridgeport on Sat 9/18.

Latin Music on McLevy Green, from 3-8 pm features Orquestra Afinke and Son 7,

celebrating Hispanic Heritage Month. Don’t miss these events happening before.

Tour the new home of Neighborhood Studios of Fairfield County from 12-3 pm, do/make art if you like.

Children can sign up for a class too!

View the art, meet the artists of Latinisiimo Exhibit at City Lights Gallery curated by Yolanda Vasquez Petrocelli Exhibit reception ends at 7 pm.

Work up a thirst at Skateportn on downtown Main St near Berlinetta Brewing Co.

Both events take place in the same building as CiTY LiGhTs Gallery and the Downtown Cabaret Theatre, near the painted steps, betweem150 Elm St and 265 Golden Hill St.

Read more about the day’s activities.

1001 Main St Suite 23, Bridgeport, CT 06604

265 Golden Hill St, Bridgeport, CT 06604

ART/DESIGN/VINTAGE/LIVE MUSIC/DEMOS & VINTAGE VINYL

Meander and mingle through the 3 blocks along Broad St from City Lights Gallery at 265 Golden Hill St and the Arcade Mall at 1042 Broad St. Enjoy exhibits at Ursa Gallery and City Lights Gallery, open studios, and music to shop by. Local vendors offer vintage clothing, furniture, accesories, artisanal creations and locally produced honey, seedling and more. The ARTcade event happens monthly on the 4th weekend. Check back monthly for dates and info.

WPKN hosts their annual Record Mash, Vintage Vinyl Sale on Fairfield Ave, cross the street from Bijou Theatre at 275 Fairfield Ave, Downtown Bridgeport CT.

See full schedule for 6/26/21

6/26/21 Downtown ARTcade Arts, Eats, Muisc

5/23/21 SUNDAY HIGHLIGHTS

Shop and tour the beautiful Arcade mall while the resonant sounds of the cello played by world renowned Jordan Jancz waft through this Victorian atrium. He starts the day of music, art, vintage and community with a 45 minute set indoors. A line up of musicians follow, playing in outdoor spaces.

LIVE MUSIC

At the Arcade Mall

10am Jordan Jancz, cello in the Arcade Mall Listen

11am Darren Vereen sings popular covers with keyboard Listen

12-2pm “The 3 Busketeers” Jordan Jancz, Dick Neal, Julie Foldes

2-4pm “Everybody Wins” Rich and Chloe Zurkowski father and daughter duo

3pm Artist’s Talk at Ursa Gallery with Iyaba Ibo Mandingo

At the City Lights patio

12-3pm DaDA Mr.

DaDA Mr. Sense the free flow of creative inspiration as Chris Cavaliere composes and riffs on guitar while Marcella Cavaliere produces an original large scale painitng before your eyes.

Savor City Buskers coordinated by Ricardo Reyes time and locations to be announced

12-4pm Artist Scott Schuldt demos bead embroidery at City Lights Gallery
